items.title: Release notes for runtime.onSuspend

items.content_html:
Description

This ensures parallel structure on RTCPeerConnection methods with deprecated parameters. The docs for getStats() were especially out of sync, but now the Syntax and Deprecated parameters sections are uniform for all. Additionally, the getStats() page now has the same section orders as the others in this PR.

Motivation

This helps to clarify for readers older syntax that they might encounter. It also clears up some ambiguity and miscues in getStats() that threw me for a personal loop this afternoon :)

Additional details

None.

Related issues and pull requests

I searched the open issues and other PRs, but did not find any reference to this page.
items.title: Uniformly describe deprecated parameters on RTCPeerConnection methods

items.content_html: Also very tempted to remove all the links except the Wikipedia one. wdyt?
items.title: Remove very Mozilla-y bit in fuzzing entry

items.content_html:
The 'Showing file(s) size' example includes a for...of statement to iterate through the file array. However, this loop construct has not been introduced previously on the page; instead a classic for loop with an iteration variable is shown as a method of iterating through FileList entries.

To prevent potential confusion, this change mentions the for...of statement and gives a snippet of how to use it before it's referenced in the example.

This change prevents potential confusion caused by the current documentation using a different loop statement for the example than was used immediately prior.

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Reference for...of statement before usage in example

items.content_html:
Firefox 111 supports:

  • autocapitalize attribute via https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1692007. This was earlier available under a flag.
    MDN page: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/autocapitalize
    Doc issue tracker: #24401

  • translate attribute via https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1418449
    MDN page: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/translate
    Doc issue tracker: #24394
items.title: FF111 release note update for autocapitalize and translate attributes

items.content_html:
Description

This PR is just one step within the larger PWA docs refresh project: mdn/mdn#280

One of the steps we need to do in this larger project is create a new sidebar, which this PR does not do. @wbamberg is working on in mdn/yari#8238.

This PR adds one new How to page to the PWA docs about display mode.

Motivation

In the PWA docs refresh project, we agreed to create a new How to section that will contain 10 to 20 new pages about many of the features that PWAs can use. Display mode is one of them.

Related issues and pull requests

  • Related to mdn/mdn#280

Next step

Once reviewed and approved, the idea is to merge this in a way that doesn't necessarily appears on MDN just yet. Once we have enough of the new content that we think is useful, we will release the new sidebar and/or landing page to link to the new stuff.
items.title: Add a new display mode How-to page to PWA docs

items.content_html:

Additional details

items.title: Document OES_draw_buffers_indexed

items.content_html: Some functions don't have their own page, as they are specific to one property. I'm using a link with a fragment. I also uniformized the use of parentheses.
items.title: Fix red links to documented CSS functions

items.content_html:
All these links lead to redirects (and each a flaw).

This fixes it; we may want to update the HTMLElement macro in the future or to have separate pages, but I don't feel in the mood of launching the discussion and doing that now.
items.title: Fix links to h1/h2/... elements

items.content_html:
Description

This PR adds docs for the View Transitions Module Level 1, which is available in Chrome 111+.

See my research document for more information on exactly what this work entails.

A couple of notes:

  • My basic demo is currently contained in a glitch instance, but I am happy to change the URLs over as soon as the dom-examples repo version has been merged.
  • For details on what exactly happens in the transition style sheet during a view transition, I've linked to relevant sections of the spec. I looked into this and felt that this was quite complex and mostly a set of internal details, which most people won't care about, but you might possibly need it if you are creating custom view transitions and want full knowledge of what you are overriding. Let me know what you think.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #24425
items.title: Add docs for the View Transitions Module Level 1

items.content_html:
This continues the work started in #24239 of removing the dictionaries RTCRtpParameter, RTCRtpReceiveParameters, RTCRtpSendParameters in
RTCRtpReceiver.setParameters(), RTCRtpReceiver.getParameters(), RTCRtpReceiver.setParameters() replacing them with objects.

The associated work for BCD has already been done in mdn/browser-compat-data#18834

This is part of the work for #23677
items.title: RTCRtpReceiver.getParameters() and friends - return value not dict

items.content_html:
Description

Clarified that test works whether or not the supplied string is undefined or null.

Motivation

Because I'm not a JS expert, I had to test this functionality manually. Having it documented here would have saved me time. Also, knowing that test works with uninitialized or null strings has value in helping users avoid both NPEs and throwing unnecessary exceptions.

Additional details

None.

Related issues and pull requests

None.
items.title: Clarified use with null or undefined strings
